com.solvvy.nlp

Class Word

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solvvy.nlp.Word

  • public class Word
extends Object
    An immutable, hashable tagged word, better in every way than the one offered by Stanford NLP. This is not equality-comparable with TaggedWord because TaggedWord does not override equals.

    • Method Detail

      • copyOf

        public static <TW extends edu.stanford.nlp.ling.HasWord & edu.stanford.nlp.ling.HasTag> Word copyOf(TW taggedWord,
                                                                                                    int index)
        Returns an immutable copy of a tagged word.
        Type Parameters:
        TW - the tagged word
        Parameters:
        taggedWord - an object containing both a word and a tag
        index - the index of the word in the parse tree. Stanford uses 1-based indices because they reserve the '0' index to mean the "un-index", or more specifically, '0' is the index of the head of the root, which has no head. Instead, we'll use 0-based indices, because we know how to use Optionals! :-D
        Returns:
        a new immutable copy of the given tagged word

      • decode

        public static Word decode(String taggedWord,
                          int index)
        Returns an immutable tagged word from a string representation of a tagged word. The String representation contains the respective space-delimited mandatory fields word and tag and optional fields stem and lemma.
        Parameters:
        taggedWord - the string representation of a tagged word
        index - the index of the word in the parse tree. Stanford uses 1-based indices because they reserve the '0' index to mean the "un-index", or more specifically, '0' is the index of the head of the root, which has no head. Instead, we'll use 0-based indices, because we know how to use Optionals! :-D
        Returns:
        the ImmutableTaggedWord after parsing the input string
